question.text: Some people think they have the right to use as much fresh water as they want, while others believe governments should tightly control the use of fresh water as it is a limited resource. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.

questionType.explanation: You must discuss BOTH perspectives equally (unlimited water use rights AND government control) and clearly state your own opinion.
requirements: Discuss arguments for unlimited personal water use rights
Discuss arguments for government-controlled water usage
Provide specific examples for each view

keyWords.importance: Signals the extreme position of no limits

keyWords.definition: Drinkable, non-saline water from rivers, lakes, groundwater
Finite supply that can be depleted
keyWords.importance: Key reason for controlling water usage

essayStructure.introduction: 2-3 sentences: Paraphrase question + state your opinion
essayStructure.body1: 4-5 sentences: Discuss individual rights perspective with examples
essayStructure.body2: 4-5 sentences: Discuss government control perspective with examples
essayStructure.conclusion: 2 sentences: Summarize both views + restate opinion

commonMistakes: Only discussing environmental side without individual rights
Being too neutral without a clear opinion
Ignoring the scarcity aspect of water resources
Not providing concrete examples like California drought or water metering

academicVocabulary.definition: Lack of sufficient available water resources
academicVocabulary.example: Water scarcity affects millions of people in arid regions worldwide.

academicVocabulary.definition: Materials from nature used by humans
academicVocabulary.example: Fresh water is a vital natural resource that must be protected.

academicVocabulary.definition: Careful use and protection of resources
academicVocabulary.example: Water conservation measures can significantly reduce household consumption.

academicVocabulary.definition: Controlled distribution of limited water supplies
academicVocabulary.example: During severe droughts, governments may implement water rationing.
Some argue that individual rights include using resources without restrictions.

academicVocabulary.definition: Using resources in ways that can continue long-term
academicVocabulary.example: Sustainable usage ensures water availability for future generations.
Many groundwater sources have been severely depleted by overuse.
Governments can regulate water consumption through pricing mechanisms.

topicVocabulary.definition: Measuring individual water consumption for billing
topicVocabulary.example: Water metering encourages households to reduce wasteful usage.

topicVocabulary.definition: Water consumption for farming and irrigation
topicVocabulary.example: Agricultural water use accounts for over 70% of global fresh water consumption.
Groundwater depletion threatens long-term water security in many regions.

topicVocabulary.definition: Extended periods of abnormally low rainfall
topicVocabulary.example: California experienced severe drought conditions requiring mandatory water restrictions.
Usage restrictions may include bans on lawn watering during droughts.

topicVocabulary.definition: People who will live in coming years
topicVocabulary.example: We must preserve water resources for future generations.

content.instructions: Build sentences you can use in your essay. Complete templates by choosing the right words.

exerciseSections.title: Thesis Statements (Introduction)
exerciseSections.description: Complete sentences that state both views and your opinion

exercises.template: While some believe _____, others argue that _____.

blanks.correctAnswer: people have unlimited water rights

options: governments must strictly regulate water consumption
blanks.correctAnswer: governments must strictly regulate water consumption

exercises.correctSentence: While some believe people have unlimited water rights, others argue that governments must strictly regulate water consumption.

exercises.template: In my opinion, _____ is necessary because _____.

blanks.correctAnswer: government regulation of water usage

options: fresh water is a finite resource essential for survival
blanks.correctAnswer: fresh water is a finite resource essential for survival

exercises.correctSentence: In my opinion, government regulation of water usage is necessary because fresh water is a finite resource essential for survival.

exerciseSections.title: Topic Sentences (Body Paragraphs)
exerciseSections.description: Start each body paragraph with a clear topic sentence

exercises.template: On the one hand, _____ believe that _____.

blanks.correctAnswer: advocates of unlimited water use

options: individuals should have the freedom to use water as needed
blanks.correctAnswer: individuals should have the freedom to use water as needed

exercises.correctSentence: On the one hand, advocates of unlimited water use believe that individuals should have the freedom to use water as needed.

exercises.template: On the other hand, _____ argue that _____.

blanks.correctAnswer: supporters of government control

options: strict water regulation protects this vital limited resource
blanks.correctAnswer: strict water regulation protects this vital limited resource

exercises.correctSentence: On the other hand, supporters of government control argue that strict water regulation protects this vital limited resource.

exerciseSections.title: Supporting Arguments (Body Paragraphs)
exerciseSections.description: Explain WHY with reasons and analysis

exercises.template: This perspective is based on _____ and _____.

blanks.correctAnswer: individual rights principles

options: the belief that personal property includes resource usage
blanks.correctAnswer: the belief that personal property includes resource usage

exercises.correctSentence: This perspective is based on individual rights principles and the belief that personal property includes resource usage.

exercises.template: The main reason is that _____ leads to _____.

blanks.correctAnswer: unrestricted water consumption

options: rapid depletion of finite water reserves
blanks.correctAnswer: rapid depletion of finite water reserves

exercises.correctSentence: The main reason is that unrestricted water consumption leads to rapid depletion of finite water reserves.

exerciseSections.title: Examples & Evidence
exerciseSections.description: Support your arguments with specific examples

blanks.correctAnswer: property owners

options: they should be able to water lawns and fill pools
blanks.correctAnswer: they should be able to water lawns and fill pools
government interference in personal choices

exercises.correctSentence: For instance, property owners argue that they should be able to water lawns and fill pools without government interference in personal choices.

blanks.correctAnswer: California during severe droughts

options: mandatory water restrictions and usage limits
blanks.correctAnswer: mandatory water restrictions and usage limits

options: successfully reduced consumption and preserved reserves
blanks.correctAnswer: successfully reduced consumption and preserved reserves

exercises.correctSentence: For example, California during severe droughts implemented mandatory water restrictions and usage limits that successfully reduced consumption and preserved reserves.

blanks.correctAnswer: individual freedom is important

options: government control is essential to ensure sustainable water usage for all
blanks.correctAnswer: government control is essential to ensure sustainable water usage for all

exercises.correctSentence: In conclusion, while individual freedom is important, I believe government control is essential to ensure sustainable water usage for all.

structure.introduction: While some believe [people have unlimited water rights], others argue that [governments must control usage]. In my opinion, [Your clear position].
structure.body1: On the one hand, [Topic sentence about individual rights]. This perspective is based on [Reason/explanation]. For instance, [Specific example]. As a result, [Consequence or position].
structure.body2: On the other hand, [Topic sentence about government control]. The main reason is [Reason/explanation]. For example, [Specific example]. Therefore, [Conclusion about this view].
structure.conclusion: In conclusion, while [Brief summary of both views], I believe [Restate your position with final thought].

presenting_first_view: Proponents of unlimited use argue that

steps.title: Build Paragraphs
steps.completionCriteria: Complete all 4 paragraphs (10+ words per blank)

content.instructions: Fill in each blank to build your essay paragraph by paragraph. Aim for 10-15 words per blank.

paragraphs.name: Introduction
paragraphs.template: While some _____ [state the first view about unlimited water rights], others _____ [state the opposite view about government control]. In my opinion, _____ [clearly state YOUR position].

blanks.label: First view about unlimited water rights
blanks.hint: Start with 'believe that individuals' or 'argue that people'
blanks.placeholder: e.g., believe that individuals have the right to use as much fresh water as they need

blanks.label: Opposite view about government control
blanks.hint: Use 'argue that' or 'contend that' followed by regulation benefits
blanks.placeholder: e.g., contend that governments must strictly regulate water consumption to preserve this limited resource

blanks.label: Your position
blanks.hint: Be clear! Take a position on water regulation
blanks.placeholder: e.g., government regulation is essential to ensure sustainable water usage for current and future generations

paragraphs.name: Body Paragraph 1
paragraphs.template: On the one hand, _____ [topic sentence about unlimited water use perspective]. This perspective is based on _____ [explain the reasoning]. For instance, _____ [give a specific example]. As a result, _____ [state the consequence or their position].

blanks.label: Topic sentence - unlimited use perspective
blanks.hint: Main argument for personal freedom in water usage
blanks.placeholder: e.g., advocates of unlimited water use believe individuals should have freedom to consume resources they pay for

blanks.label: Explain the reasoning
blanks.hint: WHY do they support unlimited use? What principle?
blanks.placeholder: e.g., the principle of individual rights and property ownership which grants people control over resources on their land

blanks.label: Specific example
blanks.hint: Give a concrete example of this argument
blanks.placeholder: e.g., homeowners argue they should be able to water lawns, fill swimming pools, and use water freely without restrictions

blanks.label: Consequence/position
blanks.hint: What do they conclude from this?
blanks.placeholder: e.g., they view government restrictions on water usage as unwarranted interference in personal freedom and property rights

paragraphs.name: Body Paragraph 2
paragraphs.template: On the other hand, _____ [topic sentence about government control]. The main reason is _____ [explain why regulation is needed]. For example, _____ [specific example]. Therefore, _____ [conclusion about this perspective].

blanks.label: Topic sentence - government control benefits
blanks.placeholder: e.g., supporters of regulation argue that governments must control water consumption because it is a finite vital resource

blanks.label: Explain why regulation needed
blanks.hint: Explain the mechanism or reasoning behind regulation
blanks.placeholder: e.g., unrestricted water consumption leads to rapid depletion of groundwater and surface water supplies threatening future availability

blanks.label: Specific example
blanks.hint: Concrete example showing benefits of regulation
blanks.placeholder: e.g., California implemented mandatory water restrictions during severe droughts which successfully reduced consumption by twenty-five percent and preserved reserves

blanks.label: Conclusion about this view
blanks.placeholder: e.g., government regulation through water metering and usage limits ensures sustainable consumption and protects water security for everyone

paragraphs.name: Conclusion
paragraphs.template: In conclusion, while _____ [briefly summarize both views], I believe _____ [restate your opinion with a final thought].

blanks.label: Summarize both views
blanks.hint: One sentence mentioning both individual rights and regulation
blanks.placeholder: e.g., individual freedom is important in democratic societies, water scarcity makes government regulation necessary

blanks.label: Restate opinion + final thought
blanks.hint: Clearly restate YOUR position and add a final insight
blanks.placeholder: e.g., strict government control of water usage is essential to ensure this vital resource remains available for current and future generations

content.instructions: Now combine your paragraphs into a complete essay. Aim for 250-280 words total.

body1.purpose: Discuss unlimited use perspective with reasons and examples

body2.purpose: Discuss government regulation with reasons and examples

checklist: Introduction clearly states both views and your opinion
Body paragraph 1 discusses individual rights perspective with example
Body paragraph 2 discusses government regulation with concrete examples
Conclusion summarizes both views and restates opinion
Linking words used to connect ideas

modelEssay.text:
The question of how fresh water should be managed has become increasingly urgent as water scarcity affects many regions worldwide. While some believe that individuals have the right to use as much water as they want, others argue that governments must tightly control water consumption. In my opinion, strict government regulation is essential because fresh water is a finite resource vital for human survival and environmental sustainability.

On the one hand, advocates of unlimited water use believe that individuals should have the freedom to consume water without government interference. This perspective is based on individual rights principles and the belief that property ownership includes the right to use resources on one's land. For instance, homeowners argue they should be able to water lawns, fill swimming pools, and maintain gardens freely, especially if they pay for the water consumed. Furthermore, some contend that market forces through pricing can naturally regulate consumption without requiring government restrictions. As a result, they view mandatory water rationing and usage limits as unwarranted interference in personal freedom.

On the other hand, supporters of government control argue that strict water regulation is necessary to protect this limited natural resource. The main reason is that unrestricted consumption leads to rapid groundwater depletion and threatens long-term water security. For example, California implemented mandatory water restrictions during severe droughts between 2012 and 2017, which successfully reduced urban water consumption by 25% and prevented reservoir depletion. Moreover, agricultural water use, which accounts for 70% of global fresh water consumption, requires careful regulation to prevent wasteful irrigation practices. Therefore, government oversight through water metering, usage limits, and conservation incentives ensures sustainable usage for current and future generations.

In conclusion, while individual freedom is valued in democratic societies, I believe that government control of fresh water usage is essential given the reality of water scarcity. Without strict regulation and conservation measures, this vital resource will be depleted, threatening human survival and ecosystem health.

structure.introduction: The question of how fresh water should be managed has become increasingly urgent as water scarcity affects many regions worldwide. While some believe that individuals have the right to use as much water as they want, others argue that governments must tightly control water consumption. In my opinion, strict government regulation is essential because fresh water is a finite resource vital for human survival and environmental sustainability.

This perspective is based on individual rights principles and the belief that property ownership includes the right to use resources on one's land. For instance, homeowners argue they should be able to water lawns, fill swimming pools, and maintain gardens freely, especially if they pay for the water consumed. Furthermore, some contend that market forces through pricing can naturally regulate consumption without requiring government restrictions. As a result, they view mandatory water rationing and usage limits as unwarranted interference in personal freedom.
structure.body2: On the other hand, supporters of government control argue that strict water regulation is necessary to protect this limited natural resource. The main reason is that unrestricted consumption leads to rapid groundwater depletion and threatens long-term water security. For example, California implemented mandatory water restrictions during severe droughts between 2012 and 2017, which successfully reduced urban water consumption by 25% and prevented reservoir depletion. Moreover, agricultural water use, which accounts for 70% of global fresh water consumption, requires careful regulation to prevent wasteful irrigation practices. Therefore, government oversight through water metering, usage limits, and conservation incentives ensures sustainable usage for current and future generations.
structure.conclusion: In conclusion, while individual freedom is valued in democratic societies, I believe that government control of fresh water usage is essential given the reality of water scarcity. Without strict regulation and conservation measures, this vital resource will be depleted, threatening human survival and ecosystem health.

highlights.explanation: Academic term for insufficient water resources

highlights.text: On the one hand... On the other hand
highlights.explanation: Classic structure for discussing two contrasting views
Using resources in ways that can continue long-term
Materials from nature used by humans
Careful use and protection of resources
